preheader: Portfolio slides as tech, gold, and cyclicals face broad selloff
opening_paragraph: The GenAi Chosen portfolio fell -5.82% this week, dropping below its starting value for the first time since inception. A broad pullback in risk assets weighed heavily on high-beta sectors, with fading risk appetite amplifying volatility across markets. Nearly all portfolio holdings faced selling pressure as investors rotated away from growth and cyclicals. This sets the stage for a deeper look at the hardest-hit sectors and how shifting sentiment affected performance.

key_insights.title: Tech Momentum Breaks
key_insights.description: Western Digital, Seagate Technology, and Palantir led the declines as investors backed away from high-beta tech and AI infrastructure names. The sharp pullback reflected growing macro uncertainty and a pronounced shift out of growth-oriented positions. These moves highlight how quickly sentiment can turn against data and AI plays in risk-off environments.

key_insights.title: Gold Miners Retreat
key_insights.description: Newmont Corp fell despite gold's traditional defensive reputation, showing that gold miners were not immune to the broad de-risking. The decline erased much of the stabilizing effect these holdings previously provided. Risk-off conditions extended across asset classes, limiting safe haven behavior.

key_insights.title: Cyclicals Lose Momentum
key_insights.description: Royal Caribbean Cruises and NRG Energy also slid as recent cyclical strength reversed. Travel and energy names that had benefited from prior momentum were unable to withstand the broader market turbulence. Their declines underscore how sensitive these sectors are to shifts in investor risk appetite.

market_context: Markets faced broad selling pressure as risk appetite faded, driving declines across high-growth tech, gold miners, and cyclical sectors. Tech names tied to AI and data infrastructure saw some of the steepest losses, reflecting heightened sensitivity to macro uncertainty. Defensive assets such as gold miners failed to provide shelter, signaling the breadth of the risk-off move. Overall sentiment shifted decisively toward caution, pulling nearly all portfolio holdings into negative territory.
market_outlook: The week underscored how quickly sentiment can shift when macro uncertainty rises, leaving momentum-driven positions exposed. Near term, volatility may remain elevated as investors reassess growth expectations and risk tolerance. Over the coming weeks, the portfolio's performance will hinge on whether risk appetite stabilizes or the rotation away from high-beta sectors continues.

benchmark_comparison.summary: The portfolio underperformed the S&P 500 while outperforming Bitcoin, both of which also declined during the broad risk-off week.
